SnowDistribution: Breakable crust at lower levels, windslab above. Mainly bright with some summit cloud. Winds around 10mph or less.
Comment: Good weather till Sunday when a frontal system arrives bringing wind, rain/snow and milder temperatures.
WeatherInfluences: Light, mainly Easterly winds. Mainly dry although some light snow showers are possible late in the afternoon. Freezing level around 200 metres.
SnowStability: Areas of unstable windslab will be present mainly on North through East to South-East aspects above 1000 metres with more localised hazard down to 800 metres. Fragile cornices will be present above these aspects. Elsewhere stability will be generally good. The avalanche hazard will be Considerable.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: It was a dry day with light South-Westerly winds. The freezing level was around 200 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Areas of poorly bonded windslab are present mainly on North through East to South-East aspects above 1000 metres. Fragile cornices are present above these aspects. Below 800 metres the snowpack now has a crust on top and stability is good. The avalanche hazard is Considerable.

SnowDistribution: Winds approx 10 - 20 mph fresh, cooling.  Clear in the morning with poor visibility in clouds in afternoon.  Deep snow at all altitudes - very hard going on foot. Knee deep at 600m!
Comment: A widespread snowpack with deep drifts in places.
WeatherInfluences: Light snow showers are forecast for the afternoon, otherwise dry. Freezing level will be around 500 metres for most of the day. Moderate winds from the North-North-East.
SnowStability: Little change to the current situation. Unstable windslab will be present in wind sheltered locations mainly on some North but mostly North-East through East to South aspects above 800 metres. Isolated unstable deposits will also be found on South-West aspects and in lee locations at lower elevations. Steep terrain such as corrie rims, gully tops, scarp slopes and steep lee locations will be most affected. Any cornices will remain suspect.  The avalanche hazard will be Considerable.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Overnight snowfall but dry during the day. A sunny morning  with hill cloud developing early afternoon. Winds were light but strengthened from the South-West in the morning. Cold throughout, around -4 degrees at 800 metres at midday.
ObservedSnowStability: Unstable windslab persists in wind sheltered locations on North-East through East to South aspects above 800 metres. More isolated unstable accumulations are also present on some North and South-West aspects above this altitude and in lee locations at lower levels. Corrie rims, gully tops, scarp slopes and steep burn lines are most affected. Fragile cornices present.  The avalanche hazard is Considerable.

SnowDistribution: Deep unconsolidated snow at all levels.  Sunny with good visibility.  Winds 20 - 25 mph at higher levels.
Comment: Recent windslab accumulations are poorly bonded and easy to trigger on steep slopes.
WeatherInfluences: Light South-South-East winds will increase to moderate during the day and back East-South-Easterly.  Snowfall is expected by late afternoon. The freezing level will be  around 500 metres.
SnowStability: During the day there will be some light drifting of lying snow.  New accumulations of unstable windslab will develop on West to North aspects above 1000 metres. Areas most affected will be gully tops coire rims and crag aprons. Fragile cornices will begin to develop. Snowpack weaknesses will persist especially on steep North to East aspects above 1000 metres. Instabilities will be more localised on other steep aspects and lower altitudes. The avalanche hazard will be Considerable.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A dry sunny day with fresh West-South-Westerly winds at higher levels.  It was freezing at all levels.
ObservedSnowStability: Light drifting at higher levels with new accumulations of poorly bonded windslab developing on Northerly to Easterly aspects above 1000 metres. Fragile cornices have developed on some of these aspects. Debris from a triggered avalanche was observed on a steep Northerly aspect at 1050 metres. Elsewhere and at lower altitudes stability is better.  The avalanche hazard is Considerable.

WeatherInfluences: The freezing level will be around 500 metres. Staying dry and cold with light East or East-South-Easterly winds.
SnowStability: Little change is expected. Areas of unstable windslab will persist in wind sheltered locations mainly on North-East through East to South aspects above 900 metres. North-West and North aspects will also be affected at high elevations. These accumulations will be quite localised but typically in sheltered hollows, coire rims, ridge flanks, gullies and gully tops. Fragile cornices will remain on similar aspects and altitudes. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: The new snow that was forecast for last night and for today didn\'t materialise, just an odd very light snow flurry but not the volume expected. It has remained mostly dry and generally calm, any winds were very light Southerlies. It froze at all levels last night the freezing level today was around 450 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Areas of unstable windslab are present in wind sheltered locations mainly on North-East through East to South aspects above 900 metres. North-West and North aspects are also affected at high elevations. These accumulations are quite localised but typically in sheltered hollows, coire rims, ridge flanks, gullies and gully tops. Fragile cornices are also present on similar aspects and altitudes.  The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

SnowDistribution: Deep snow at all altitudes - very hard going on foot.  Cloud base was around 700 metres most of the day. Winds approx 10-20mph.
Comment: Deep snow making travel by walking hard work.
WeatherInfluences: A dry cloudy day with light East-South-Easterly winds. The freezing level will rise to around 550 metres.
SnowStability: Despite some consolidation weaknesses will remain in recent windslab accumulations. Instabilities possible in windslab deposits on steep slopes on all aspects with greatest accumulations on North-East through East to South-West aspects above 600 metres. Fragile cornices will be present. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: After a few snow showers this morning it was a mainly dry day with moderate Westerly winds. Freezing at most levels with little change in temperature with height, the temperature at 925 metres rose to -1.8 degrees Celsius.
ObservedSnowStability: The snowpack is gradually consolidating however instabilities persist in recent windslab accumulations. Instabilities remain on all aspects with greatest accumulations on North-East through East to South-West aspects above 600 metres. Fragile cornices are present. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

SnowDistribution: Deep snow at all altitudes - very hard going on foot. Good visibility most of the time. Winds 10-15mph.
Comment: Variable snow conditions with breakable crust at lower and mid elevations, hard and soft windslab and exposed ice in places.
WeatherInfluences: Winds are expected to be very light, generally Easterly. It will be freezing at most levels. It is expected to be dry throughout, though a few snow showers are possible in the afternoon.
SnowStability: Little change is expected. Recently deposited windslab will continue to slowly consolidate in the settled conditions, though weaknesses will remain especially in accumulations on steeper slopes. Greatest accumulations will lie on North through East to South aspects above 900 metres. Fragile cornices will be present above these aspects. Windslab with weaknesses will also lie on South-West aspects. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: It was a dry cold day, freezing at all levels. Winds were light mainly South-South-Westerly.
ObservedSnowStability: Recently deposited windslab is slowly consolidating in the settled conditions, though weaknesses remain especially in accumulations on steeper slopes. Greatest accumulations lie on North through East to South aspects above 900 metres. Fragile cornices are present above these aspects. Windslab with weaknesses also lies on South-West aspects. There is a widespread thin melt freeze crust below 800m overlain by windslab on East to South aspects above 700 metres. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.
